text: here the fellow travelers mark here with
Walters room today we're here in
Vancouver and British Columbia in Canada
and today we're going to talk about is
actually tipping in Canada because a
question we get a lot of times from
people is Mark do I tip we're going to
go or how do I tip or do I even tip so
we're gonna talk about that here in
Canada and yes in Canada you do tip you
tip your waiters between 15 and 20
percent that's how it works or not I
know not everybody wants to tip but
that's how they make their wages here in
Canada that work the service and stuff
like that so don't forget to tip okay
now your taxi drivers you're gonna tip
them about ten percent so you have a
rough idea for them but I think that's
important to know about tipping when you
are here it's also you should know about
the GST or the HST so the GST the goods
and services tax or the HST which is the
harmonized sales tax that you'll find
throughout Canada they do have sales tax
that are actually added on after you buy
something so for example we got a whale
watching tour it was 170 bucks per
person and then there was the five
percent GST added on here in Vancouver
and the thing is is that sales tax will
be different in each different province
so do pay attention what you're going to
pay because it could be five percent it
could be up to 15 percent just so you
know I'm sure I'm putting up a list of
the different provinces GST s and H St
so you do know that but that is
something you should know but in general
just so you know in in Canada yes you do
tip and the service is very friendly so
you're not gonna mind a tip so there you
go anyway
I hope that helped you know a little bit
more if you want more more about tipping
in Canada sorry if you want to know more
about visiting Canada five things you
love and hate about visiting Canada or
